Q: Hi Doctor, my fiance has been advised to take Krimson 35 as a contraceptive pill . We are getting married in 2 days and we wanted to use a contraceptive, hence this was advised. She is a virgin and has never used any contraceptive pills before. What are the major side effects of this pill? Is it safe to use? WWW.WWWW.WW
A: Yes it is safe to use crimson 35. The use of oral contraceptives increases the risk of- thrombophlebitis, arterial thromboembolism, pulmonary embolism, myocardial infarction, cerebral hemorrhage, cerebral thrombosis, hypertension,hepatic adenoid, retinal thrombosis.Anyone with a family history of cerebral hemorrhage should consult her doctor prior to starting oral contraceptives. Other side effects include nausea, vomiting,git symptoms, breakthrough bleeding, spotting,change in menstrual flow, temporary infertility after discontinuation of treatment, oedema, breast tenderness, breast enlargement, breast secretion, change in weight, mood changes, skin troubles etc. These are Chat Doctor.
